page.title: 16SILCOATES SCHOOL GALA
page.content: On the 6th of July 1985 on a Saturday there was a Gala in the grounds of Silcoates School. My Mother and I walked to the school and went in to find stalls selling cake, biscuits and buns. She gave me a pound note and I went on 'Treasure Island' and 'find the key' but did not win anthing. As well as stalls and games, there was pony riding round the field which cost 20p. My favourite game was where we had to pick an egg out of sand and won 50p if the egg was cracked. Another very good game was hammering nails into wood. After going round the stalls and talking to people in the bright sunshine we left to walk home. The proceeds were for the school funds and charity.
